response_text:
<![CDATA[CBC | Sports News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/?cmp=rss en-ca Thu, 12 May 2016 23:53:31 EDT CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA[Joe(s) and Co. feed on Predators to reach West final]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/hockey/nhl/sharks-blow-out-preds-1.3580343?cmp=rss 1.3580343 Thu, 12 May 2016 23:53:31 EDT The Associated Press Sports/Hockey/NHL

Captain Joe Pavelski got San Jose off to a fast start in Game 7 with his franchise record-tying ninth goal of the playoffs to send the Sharks to their first Western Conference final in five years with a 5-0 victory over the Nashville Predators on Thursday night.

]]> <![CDATA[Russia accused of running widespread doping operation during Sochi Olympics]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/olympics/winter/russia-doping-report-1.3579290?cmp=rss 1.3579290 Thu, 12 May 2016 13:34:58 EDT Reuters Sports/Olympics/Winter Sports

Dozens of Russian athletes who competed at the 2014 Sochi Winter Olympics, including at least 15 medal winners, were part of a state-run doping program, the New York Times reports.

]]> <![CDATA['They were most likely doping': Canadian ski coach on allegations about Russian athletes]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/olympics/winter/russia-doping-cross-country-ski-1.3579604?cmp=rss 1.3579604 Thu, 12 May 2016 15:32:04 EDT Mihira Lakshman Sports/Olympics/Winter Sports

Justin Wadsworth, who ran Canada's cross-country ski program for most of the past decade, calls the revelations in the New York Times "vindication" for the sport.

]]> <![CDATA[Raptors aim to end the suffering in Game 6]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/basketball/nba/raptors-heat-game-6-preview-1.3580070?cmp=rss 1.3580070 Thu, 12 May 2016 19:10:57 EDT The Associated Press Sports/Basketball/NBA

The Toronto Raptors have their first shot at sending the Heat packing when the teams meet for Game 6 of their best-of-seven series in Miami on Friday.

]]> <![CDATA[Thunder eliminate Spurs to advance to West final]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/basketball/nba/thunder-eliminate-spurs-advance-west-final-1.3580383?cmp=rss 1.3580383 Thu, 12 May 2016 23:10:52 EDT The Associated Press Sports/Basketball/NBA

Kevin Durant scored 37 points, Russell Westbrook added 28, and the Oklahoma City Thunder beat the San Antonio Spurs 113-99 on Thursday night to win the Western Conference semifinal series 4-2.

]]> <![CDATA[Lightning take soap-opera route back to East final]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/hockey/nhl/wharnsby/tampa-bay-lightning-1.3579590?cmp=rss 1.3579590 Thu, 12 May 2016 15:22:24 EDT Tim Wharnsby Sports/Hockey/NHL/Tim Wharnsby

It seemed like a long shot only a few weeks ago, but the Tampa Bay Lightning are back in the Eastern Conference final after surviving a season with more twists and turns than a few months on Coronation Street, writes Tim Wharnsby.

]]> <![CDATA[Revamped Penguins, recuperating Lightning set for East final]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/hockey/nhl/revamped-pens-speedy-bolts-set-1.3580098?cmp=rss 1.3580098 Thu, 12 May 2016 19:19:37 EDT Will Graves Sports/Hockey/NHL

A lot has changed since the Tampa Bay Lightning and the Pittsburgh Penguins met less than three months ago in the regular season. Tampa's injury concerns and Pittsburgh's impressive depth will be key during the East final.

]]> <![CDATA[Hall's 2 goals salvage Canadian win over Germany.]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/hockey/canada-world-championships-1.3579751?cmp=rss 1.3579751 Thu, 12 May 2016 16:36:54 EDT Carol Schram Sports/Hockey

Taylor Hall scored twice as Canada survived a second-period scare and defeated Germany 5-2 Thursday at the world hockey championship.

]]> <![CDATA[Is King James pondering retirement? It's up to his kids]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/basketball/nba/lebron-james-retirement-kids-1.3579930?cmp=rss 1.3579930 Thu, 12 May 2016 17:42:18 EDT The Associated Press Sports/Basketball/NBA

Cleveland Cavaliers star LeBron James isn't giving any set date when it comes to his retirement, stating that his kids will make the ultimate decision.

]]> <![CDATA[Diamond League: Shawn Barber, Renaud Lavillenie set for pole vault showdown]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/olympics/summer/trackandfield/barber-diamond-league-shanghai-preview-1.3579417?cmp=rss 1.3579417 Thu, 12 May 2016 14:27:58 EDT Doug Harrison Sports/Olympics/Summer Sports/Track and Field

The anticipated Shawn Barber-Renaud Lavillenie pole vault matchup at the world indoor championships in March quickly fizzled when nerves got the better of Barber. But the Canadian will get another shot at Saturday's Diamond League meet in China, live streamed on CBC Sports.

]]> <![CDATA[That's what we call a good Day on the golf course]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/golf/jason-day-players-championship-pga-1.3580112?cmp=rss 1.3580112 Thu, 12 May 2016 19:50:05 EDT Doug Ferguson Sports/Golf

Jason Day created a far better memory Thursday than his last round at the TPC Sawgrass. Not only was he 18 shots better, the world's No. 1 player tied the course record with a 9-under 63 that gave him a two-shot lead in The Players Championship in Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla.

]]> <![CDATA[Rouyn-Noranda wins QMJHL, earns berth in Memorial Cup]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/hockey/rouyn-noranda-qmjhl-memorial-cup-1.3580406?cmp=rss 1.3580406 Thu, 12 May 2016 22:42:10 EDT The Canadian Press Sports/Hockey

Martins Dzierkals scored twice, including the eventual winner, as the Rouyn-Noranda Huskies routed the Shawinigan Cataractes 7-2 on Thursday to win the QMJHL's President's Cup in five games.

]]> <![CDATA['Genie goes 'poof' at Italian Open]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/tennis/eugenie-bouchard-3rd-round-italian-open-barbora-strycova-1.3579916?cmp=rss 1.3579916 Thu, 12 May 2016 17:29:59 EDT The Canadian Press Sports/Tennis

Canadian Eugenie Bouchard lost to Barbora Strycova of the Czech Republic 6-1, 6-0 on Thursday in the third round of the Italian Open.

]]> <![CDATA[Kenya in doubt for Rio Olympics after breaking anti-doping rules]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/olympics/summer/kenya-anti-doping-wada-1.3579340?cmp=rss 1.3579340 Thu, 12 May 2016 13:54:33 EDT Eddie Pells Sports/Olympics/Summer Sports

World Anti-Doping Agency officials declared Kenya's drug-fighting agency out of compliance Thursday, a move that places the track powerhouse's participation in this summer's Rio Olympics in jeopardy.

]]> <![CDATA[What you need to know for Predators-Sharks Game 7]]> http://www.cbc.ca/sports/hockey/nhl/nhl-need-to-know-predators-sharks-1.3578730?cmp=rss 1.3578730 Thu, 12 May 2016 10:57:18 EDT Jesse Campigotto Sports/Hockey/NHL

Get up to speed on the important news from the Stanley Cup playoffs, where the Nashville Predators and the San Jose Sharks square off in Game 7 tonight with a trip to the Western Conference final on the line.

]]>
